title: Othellobit
author: Othellobit
content: newbies keep asking question on how to grow in Bitcoin.  Many experienced speaks more about the risks involved without saying nothing about the safety measures that one can take, why many speak about having the knowledge first, yet they contribute little or nothing to how this knowledge can be gotten. This leaves newbie with fear and different questions as of how, when and where they will get this Bitcoin knowledge easily, so I'm on a plea that the experienced should give more solution approach to this questions>>>> #how, where and when.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: How do you grow your bitcoin? The same way how you grow your money. By investing, trading, getting a job, starting a business, mining, you know the drill. Bitcoin isn't some magic money that you can magically grow with little to no effort.

Oh, my God! OP, can you read? Starting a topic with complaints indicates your inability to switch between sections of the forum.Almost all sections are full of warnings that you should not invest the money on which your financial well-being may depend. When investing in Bitcoin, you must understand that you are taking on the risks associated with cryptocurrencies. Read about the preferred wallets for holding Bitcoin, learn how to store your passphrases, and read about which exchanges to hold your assets on.I am not sure that you have not met similar questions and answers to them on the forum. But if you want a guarantee that someone will tell you how to become a millionaire without taking any risks, I think you have chosen the wrong forum.

comments.author: buwaytress
comments.body: Unpopular to recommend but I'm with mk4 on "get a job".I think the danger with Bitcoin or any kind of investment is people get enamoured with the promise, and then abandon themselves and their careers/skills/livelihood. So save yourself time and use it to get better value for youself.If you're like me or most people, you can't really afford to deep dive and entrench yourself in it. Instead, do your job well, upskill, gain experience, focus on yourself, and you'll be able to expand your income -- and then DCA strategy benefits.That's the long-term solution. No magic bitcoin tree.

comments.author: tbct_mt2
comments.body: Quote from: buwaytress on March 10, 2023, 02:52:10 PMUnpopular to recommend but I'm with mk4 on "get a job".I think the danger with Bitcoin or any kind of investment is people get enamoured with the promise, and then abandon themselves and their careers/skills/livelihood. So save yourself time and use it to get better value for youself.Get a job and use part of salary for investment in Bitcoin. It makes their bitcoin investment more sustainable long term.If they use all salary for investment, it turns to be unsustainable because when they lose a job or when they need money (cash), they must sell their bitcoin and not all times they can sell it at profitable price.Investment is executed to gain profit but investors must have plans they won't have profit but loss instead from their investment. What will they do with loss like this, they must have reserved money to use.Fortunately with Bitcoin, if you don't have to sell it at bottom, you can sell it at new all time high in a next bull run that comes after a next halving.Knowing about next block reward halving is important too: https://bitcoinblockhalf.com/Controlled supply for future halvings after 2024.

comments.author: tbterryboy
comments.body: One of the best ways to start learning about Bitcoin is to read as much as you can about it. There are several books, blogs, and forums (including this one, in fact, it's the biggest and most knowledgeable one) available that provide valuable information about Bitcoin, its history, and how it works. There are also several online courses and tutorials available that can help you gain a better understanding of Bitcoin and its underlying technology.In terms of safety measures, it's important to store your Bitcoin in a secure wallet where you control the private keys, like a hardware wallet. You should also use a strong and unique password for your wallet and enable two-factor authentication wherever possible.Remember to research and carefully consider any investment opportunities related to Bitcoin before investing. Make sure to only invest what you can afford to lose and diversify your portfolio to minimize risk.
